intro: Paullinia affinis, commonly known as the Brazilian soursop or the Brazilian guava, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces a fruit that is similar in appearance to the soursop but has a distinct flavor and texture. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses. The species is also valued for its ability to thrive in shaded environments.
